columns.name: ID
columns.description: Unique identifier for each row

columns.name: TAXONOMY_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the taxonomy of the category

columns.name: PARENT_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the parent category

columns.name: NAME
columns.description: Name of the category

columns.name: SLUG
columns.description: URL-friendly version of the category name

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: Detailed description of the category

columns.name: H1
columns.description: Heading for the category page

columns.name: TITLE
columns.description: Title for the category page

columns.name: META_DESCRIPTION
columns.description: Meta description for SEO purposes

columns.name: META_KEYWORDS
columns.description: Meta keywords for SEO purposes

columns.name: CREATED_AT
columns.description: Date and time when the row was created

columns.name: UPDATED_AT
columns.description: Date and time when the row was last updated

columns.name: DELETED_AT
columns.description: Date and time when the row was deleted, if applicable

columns.name: SCRAPED_AT
columns.description: Date and time when the data was scraped

columns.name: SESSION_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the session when the data was scraped

ai_analysis.table_purpose: This table stores information about different categories of products or items. Each row represents a unique category with details such as its name, description, SEO metadata, and timestamps for creation, update, and deletion. The 'PARENT_ID' field suggests that categories may be organized in a hierarchical structure.
ai_analysis.data_quality_notes: The 'CREATED_AT' and 'UPDATED_AT' fields contain some negative timestamps which seem incorrect. The 'META_KEYWORDS' field is mostly null, indicating it might not be used consistently. The 'DELETED_AT' field is all null, suggesting that no rows have been deleted or the feature is not used.

columns.name: ID
columns.description: Unique identifier for each product

columns.name: WP_ID
columns.description: WordPress identifier, can be null

columns.name: FEATURED
columns.description: Flag to indicate if the product is featured (0 or 1)

columns.name: NAME
columns.description: Name of the product

columns.name: SLUG
columns.description: URL-friendly version of the product name

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: Detailed description of the product

columns.name: SKU
columns.description: Stock keeping unit for the product

columns.name: USER_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the user who added/updated the product

columns.name: COLOUR_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the product color

columns.name: BRAND_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the product brand

columns.name: CATEGORY_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the product category

columns.name: PRICE
columns.description: Product price

columns.name: SALE_PRICE
columns.description: Discounted price of the product

columns.name: REPORTING_PRICE
columns.description: Price used for reporting purposes, can be null

columns.name: URL
columns.description: Product page URL

columns.name: ORIGINAL_URL
columns.description: Original product URL, can be null

columns.name: IN_STOCK
columns.description: Flag to indicate if the product is in stock (0 or 1)

columns.name: POPULARITY
columns.description: Product popularity score

columns.name: HAS_IMAGE
columns.description: Flag to indicate if the product has an image (0 or 1), can be null

columns.name: CREATED_AT
columns.description: Timestamp when the product was created

columns.name: UPDATED_AT
columns.description: Timestamp when the product was last updated

columns.name: DELETED_AT
columns.description: Timestamp when the product was deleted, can be null

columns.name: LAST_CHANGED_AT
columns.description: Timestamp when the product was last changed, can be null

columns.name: BRAND_NAME
columns.description: Name of the product brand

columns.name: CATEGORY_NAME
columns.description: Name of the product category

columns.name: TEXTURE
columns.description: Flag to indicate if the product has a texture

columns.name: THUMBNAIL
columns.description: URL for the product thumbnail image

columns.name: IMAGE
columns.description: URL for the product image

columns.name: CATEGORY_LVL0
columns.description: Top-level product category

columns.name: CATEGORY_LVL1
columns.description: Second-level product category

columns.name: CATEGORY_LVL2
columns.description: Third-level product category, can be null

columns.name: SCRAPED_AT
columns.description: Timestamp when the product data was scraped

columns.name: SESSION_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the session when the product data was scraped

ai_analysis.table_purpose: This table stores product information, including details such as product name, description, price, brand, category, and image URLs. It also tracks metadata like creation, update, and deletion timestamps, as well as the session during which the data was scraped.
ai_analysis.data_quality_notes: Some columns contain null values (WP_ID, COLOUR_ID, BRAND_ID, REPORTING_PRICE, ORIGINAL_URL, HAS_IMAGE, DELETED_AT, LAST_CHANGED_AT, CATEGORY_LVL2). The 'TEXTURE' column appears to contain boolean data but is stored as an integer. The 'BRAND_NAME' and 'CATEGORY_NAME' columns seem to duplicate information already present in the 'BRAND_ID' and 'CATEGORY_ID' columns.

columns.name: PRODUCT_ID
columns.description: Unique identifier for each product. This is used to link the product image to the product details.

columns.name: NAME
columns.description: Name of the image file, typically in the format 'PRODUCT_ID.jpg'.

columns.name: URL
columns.description: The direct link to where the image is stored, in this case, an Amazon S3 bucket.

columns.name: SCRAPED_AT
columns.description: The timestamp indicating when the image was scraped or added to the database.

columns.name: SESSION_ID
columns.description: Unique identifier for the session during which the image was scraped. This could be useful for tracking or logging purposes.

ai_analysis.table_purpose: This table appears to store information about product images, including their unique identifiers, file names, URLs, and the timestamps of when they were scraped. It likely supports a larger system that involves product information.
ai_analysis.data_quality_notes: The data provided seems consistent and well-structured. However, without more context or additional data, it's hard to make definitive statements about data quality. For instance, it would be useful to check if all product IDs in this table correspond to existing products, if all URLs are valid and lead to the correct images, and if the 'SCRAPED_AT' timestamps are accurate and consistent with the actual scraping times.
